total_revenue.context: Total revenue for Q1, down 5% year-over-year, or 3% adjusted for foreign exchange

segments.name: iPhone

revenue.context: Revenue from iPhone segment, down 15% year-over-year

key_points: Active installed base surpassed 900 million devices
99% customer satisfaction for iPhone XR, XS and XS Max combined
90% customer loyalty rating in the US
81% of business buyers plan to purchase iPhones in March quarter
Affected by reduced carrier subsidies and battery replacement program
Lower upgrade rates than anticipated
Impact from macro conditions in emerging markets

segments.name: Services
key_points: Over 360 million paid subscriptions across Services portfolio
Record App Store performance during holiday period
Apple Pay reached 1.8 billion transactions in the quarter
Apple News reached 85 million monthly active users
Apple Music achieved highest quarterly music revenue ever
Cloud services revenue grew over 40% year-over-year
More than 30,000 third-party subscription apps available

segments.name: Mac

revenue.context: Best quarter ever for Mac revenue, up 9% year-over-year

key_points: Strong response to new MacBook Air and Mac mini
Growth in majority of tracked countries
Record active installed base
Half of Mac purchasers were new to Mac
Double-digit growth in many large markets

segments.name: iPad
key_points: Strong performance of both iPad and iPad Pro
Double-digit growth in four of five geographic segments
Record active installed base
94% customer satisfaction rating
68% of business tablet buyers plan to purchase iPads
Half of iPad purchasers were new to iPad

segments.name: Wearables, Home and Accessories

revenue.context: Revenue grew 33% to new all-time record

key_points: Revenue up over $1.8 billion year-over-year
Strong popularity of Apple Watch and AirPods
Supply constraints for both Apple Watch and AirPods
Business approaching size of Fortune 200 company
Record performance in all geographic segments

strategic_initiatives: Making iPhone trade-ins easier in stores
Expanding iPhone installment payment programs globally
Growing Services business towards 500 million paid subscriptions by 2020
Expanding Apple Pay to new markets and merchants
Launching Apple News in Canada with first bilingual offering

market_opportunities.services: Growing paid subscriptions expected to surpass 500 million by 2020

market_opportunities.healthcare: Expanding health monitoring capabilities through Apple Watch

market_opportunities.enterprise: Growing adoption across healthcare, manufacturing, and construction industries

introduction: December quarter revenue was $84.3 billion, down 5% from a year ago
Performance impacted by four factors: different iPhone launch timing, FX headwinds, supply constraints, and macro conditions
Record performance in many markets including Americas, Western Europe, and Central/Eastern Europe
services: Services revenue reached all-time record of $10.9 billion
App Store had record holiday period
Apple Music achieved highest quarterly music revenue ever
Apple Pay transactions exceeded 1.8 billion in the quarter
Cloud services growing rapidly with revenue up over 40%
Apple News reached 85 million monthly active users
products: iPhone XR, XS, and XS Max are best iPhones ever shipped
Customers holding onto older iPhones longer than expected
Mac revenue up 9% with strong response to new MacBook Air and Mac mini
iPad revenue up 17%, highest growth in almost six years
Wearables business grew 33% with strong Apple Watch and AirPods sales

introduction: Set new all-time revenue records in multiple regions
iPhone revenue declined 15% while rest of business grew 19%
First-time disclosure of products and services gross margins
financials: Net income at $20 billion, about flat to last year
Operating cash flow strong at $26.7 billion
